name: places/ChIJ2xpC33ZZwokRFIpnV_pH58k
formattedAddress: 318 W 22nd St, New York, NY 10011, USA
adrFormatAddress: 318 W 22nd St, New York, NY 10011-2602, USA

originalText.text: The place was overall great! We loved our stay in Chelsea. The place was very clean, organized, and in great and safe location to everything in the city. Plus the other guests staying were very friendly. The only two things is I wish the place would provide better quality towels and more than one for each person, at least 2 nice size towels. As well as better communication on the property management side. Overall, I would recommend Outsite to friends/family.

originalText.text:
One Of Best Co-Living/Co Working Experiences

I joined Outsite just before planning for my trip in NYC.
Being in the remote work culture for a while now, was looking for a sustainable place where I could feel at ease with living and working space.
As per Outsite Chelsea, I could only say nice words.
-Room clean with adequate space comparing to other locations in NYC.
-Loved the co working area.
-Didn't make that much use but kitchen had all amenities and a stylish living room. Clean and comfortable, most important.
-Cecile is an amazing Community Manager. My flight got cancelled and she helped me a lot with extending the stay at Outsite Chelsea. She's very responsive, accommodating and made me feel welcomed.
-Location is great and a safe neighborhood.

originalText.text: The location is hard to beat, and over all a secure and well renovated building. Shower was good, bed was good, but the windows are a mess. They have absolutely no noise or weather insulation. The community manager is wonderful, she responded to my texts super quick and had great recommendations.

text.text: The location is hard to beat, and over all a secure and well renovated building. Shower was good, bed was good, but the windows are a mess. They have absolutely no noise or weather insulation. The community manager is wonderful, she responded to my texts super quick and had great recommendations.

originalText.text:
I stayed at the Outsite Chelsea house for 2 weeks. Overall I really enjoyed it and will likely try it again! Can't beat the price and location!

PROs:
- My stay at the Chelsea location in Outsite was generally enjoyable.
- The property appears to have been recently renovated, giving it a fresh and modern feel. I hope it can be maintained in this way —already some of the furniture/wardrobes had begun to have misaligned door panels and broken handles.
- Fantastic location in Chelsea, absolutely couldn't be beat!
- The shared spaces were beautifully designed and well-maintained.
- The workspace provided was aesthetically pleasing and conducive to productivity.
- I had a clean room, and it was notably quiet as my room was situated at the back of the house.
- The cleanliness, tidiness, and tranquility of the property were well-maintained when there were fewer guests.
- I received my Amazon package without any issues, which added to the convenience of my stay.
- The price for my stay was excellent and represented great value
- I think the demographics of the house were pretty evenly split 50% women and 50% men which was nice and added to my level of safety as a solo traveler
- Met amazing other Outsite stayers who shared meals, watched shows, and went out together :)

CONS:
- The bathrooms at times were not as clean as expected (ex. finding random stranger's beard hairs in the sink or leaks on the toilet seat) and I don't think anyone's cleaned the Brita filter in months. Complimentary cleaning service comes once a week, but could probably benefit from more :)
- The website lacked clarity regarding the accessibility of the house, and there was no assistance with luggage, which may catch guests off guard.
- There was an unexpected situation where the Brooklyn Outsite house was abruptly closed, and guests were relocated to the Chelsea house... It would be reassuring to see a public resolution from Outsite regarding this matter, as it raises concerns about future stays with the company due to the lack of transparency surrounding the incident.
- The wifi was in and out the last few days of my stay, which was extremely inconvenient. It also doesn't reach the 4th floor - so beware!

originalText.text: Finding affordable accommodation in New York that’s 1) clean and 2) well located is hard - and Outsite fit the bill perfectly. I was really impressed by the communal spaces and the beautiful rooftop. I’d definitely stay here again when visiting the city, and am now looking out for Outsite properties in other parts of the world for my future travels!
